chargeHist.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)
Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.execSummary:
The defendant Damien Nickile Martinez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • OWI (4th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Payment of $600 fine + costs + DNA surcharge = $1819.00 - payment to be worked out with agent.

No possession or consumption of alcohol or controlled substances illegal in WI today without a valid prescription.
No THC in any form.
No entry into any bars, taverns, or other places that sell alcohol as their principal business.

No firearms.
May not vote or serve on a jury until civil rights are restored.

Mental health evaluation and follow through.
Must take any medications as prescribed for Mental Health or Substance Abuse.
May only take vivitrol - no suboxone or methadone.
Any medications, including those prescribed, may only be taken with prior agent approval.
Completion of all assessments, counseling, and follow through as recommended by agent.
Full compliance with the Marinette County Mental Health Treatment Court program.
DNA sample due 10-18-2022.

timeConds.notes: First 60 days of 1 year sentence imposed, consecutive to the jail sentence in 22CT9, with remainder of 1 year sentence imposed and stayed - to be used by Treatment Court Judge for treatment or sanction purposes.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

Deft to participate in some sort of support group meeting at least 2 times per week.
Dr, Powers heard.

records.addlTxt:
2:36 PM Defendant Damien Nickile Martinez in court, in custody.  Attorney Brad Hansen in court for Damien Nickile Martinez.  Attorney Kathryn Heineck in court for State of Wisconsin. Mental Health Coordinator, Lisa Spencer, is present in the courtroom.
Court calls cases 21CT87, 22CF154, 22CF169, 22CT9, and 21TR1149.
Court begins with a plea hearing in 22CT9:
Atty Hansen provides a plea form.
ADA heard on agreement.
Court arraigns Deft on Count 1 of 22CT9.
Deft enters a plea of no contest to Count 1 of 22CT9.
Non-citizen advisory.
PleaQuest/WOR.
Constitutional rights.
Read-ins.
Deft understands.
Elements of offense.
Court reviews prior convictions.
Deft agrees.
Atty Hansen agrees.
Atty Hansen satisfied.
Factual basis.
Court finds Deft enters plea freely, voluntarily and intelligently; therefore court accepts the plea and finds the Deft guilty to Count 1 of 22CT9.
Court dismisses and reads-in Count 2 of 22CT9.
2:55 prelim and plea hearing on 22CF169.
ADA provides a copy of the amended information to the Court.
Atty Hansen heard.
Atty Hansen provides a prelim waiver and a plea form.
Court accepts the amended information.
Count 1 is changed to a 4th offense.
Court reviews amended charges and max penalties.
Deft understands.
Court arraigns Deft on the amended Count 1.
Deft enters a plea of no contest.
Non-citizen advisory.
No firearms.
May not vote or serve on a jury until civil rights are restored.
PleaQuest/WOR.
Constitutional rights.
Read-ins.
Deft understands.
Elements of offense.
Court reviews prior convictions.
Deft agrees.
Atty Hansen satisfied.
Atty Hansen heard.
Deft agrees.
Factual basis.
Court finds Deft enters plea freely, voluntarily and intelligently; therefore court accepts plea and finds Deft guilty to the amended Count 1 of 22CF169.
Court dismisses and reads-in Counts 2, 3, 4, and 5 of 22CF169.
Court dismisses and reads-in Count 1 of 21CT87.
Court dismisses and reads-in Counts 1, 2, and 3 of 22CF154.
Court dismisses and reads-in Count 1 of 21TR1149.
ADA heard on sentencing recommendation for 22CT9.
Atty Hansen heard.
Deft heard.
Court heard on factors.
Court imposes on Count 1 of 22CT9:
60 days jail, with good time and huber release.
Credit for 45 days time served.
Payment of $600 fine + costs + DNA surcharge = $1744.00 - $250 bond on deposit in case 21CT87 to be applied to fees due with remaining balance due at $50 per month beginning 12-01-2022 or civil judgment and referral to State Debt Collections.
24 months drivers license revocation.
24 months IID.
DNA sample due 10-18-2022.
3:13 ADA heard on sentencing recommendation for 22CF169.
Atty Hansen heard.
Deft heard.
Court heard on factors.
Court imposed and stayed on Count 1 of 22CF169:
18 months initial confinement, 2 years extended supervision, and places deft on probation for 3 years.
Credit for 73 days time served.
Not eligible for CIP.
Eligible for SAP.
Conditions of probation:
Full compliance with the Marinette County Mental Health Treatment Court program.
1 year jail - must serve the first 60 days, consecutive to the jail sentence in 22CT9, with remainder of 1 year sentence imposed and stayed and to be used by Treatment Court Judge for treatment or sanction purposes.
Payment of $600 fine + costs + DNA surcharge = $1819.00 - payment to be worked out with agent.
36 months drivers license revocation.
36 months IID.
No possession or consumption of alcohol or controlled substances illegal in WI today without a valid prescription.
No THC in any form.
Any medications, including those prescribed, may only be taken with prior agent approval.
Must take any medications as prescribed for Mental Health or Substance Abuse.
May not take suboxone or methadone and may only take vivitrol.
No entry into any bars, taverns, or any other places that sell alcohol as their principal business.
AODA evaluation and follow through.
Mental Health evaluation and follow through.
Completion of all assessments, counseling and follow through as recommended by agent.
DNA sample due 10-18-2022.
No firearms.
May not vote or serve on a jury until civil rights are restored.
Mental Health Coordinator heard.
Appeal rights.
3:33 PM

records.addlTxt:
8:30 AM Defendant Damien Nickile Martinez appeared by ZOOM, in custody at Menominee County Jail.  Attorney DeShea Morrow in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Court calls case.
DA heard.
Court inquires on atty.
Deft heard - has spoken to Atty Hansen.
Atty Hansen enters the courtroom.
Atty Hansen heard - has reviewed complaint with Deft.
Deft understands charges and penalties.
Waives formal reading.
Requests prelim.
Court schedules with parties.
Atty Hansen to let the state know by July 15th if it will be a waiver.
8:32 AM
Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 21, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Order For Defendant To Abstain From Alcohol And For Testing

8:34 AM Defendant Damien Nickile Martinez appeared by video, in custody at Menominee County Jail.  Attorney robert James mraz in court for State of Wisconsin. Atty Brad Hansen appears in the courtroom.
Court calls case.
Atty Hansen heard - represents deft in other cases and will likely represent on this case as well.
Has not had a chance to review these charges with the deft yet.
Copy of complaint.
Court reviews charges and max penalties.
Deft understands.
Atty Hansen heard and requests a prelim within time limits.
ADA heard - Atty Hansen does not formally represent deft yet.
Court schedules with parties.
ADA heard on bond recommendation.
Atty Hansen heard.
Court imposes $2500 cash bail w/ condition; sign waiver of extradition, no operating a motor vehicle without a valid license, no entry into bars or taverns, no possession or consumption of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid Rx, compliance with Soberlink, no THC for any reason.
8:42 AM
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for July 11, 2022 at 08:30 am.
